description: Construction of three-storey infill extension, comprising additional classrooms, learning resource centre and associated hardstanding and electricity substation; construction of part single, part two-storey sports hall extension, with ancillary changing facilities; installation of detached two-storey temporary (two years) classroom structure; retrospective application to retain detached single-storey classroom structure for a temporary two-year period (departure application) (major application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | (a) The retention of the single-storey, two classroom, temporary modular building (Block A), associated access and hardstanding, shall be permitted for a limited period, from the date of this planning permission, until 31.08.2022, or upon first use of the two-storey temporary modular building (Block B), at which point Block A, associated access and hardstanding, shall be removed from the site and the land reinstated in accordance with approved proposed site plan (1712PL(2)100-Rev-P12).

(b) The two-storey, ten classroom, temporary modular building (Block B), associated access and hardstanding, shall be permitted for a limited period, from the date of this planning permission, until 31.08.2023, when Block B, associated access and hardstanding, shall be removed from the site and the temporarily developed grassland reinstated in accordance with approved proposed site plan (1712PL(2)100-Rev-P12).

Reason: The building and works, due to their nature, location and appearance, are considered unsuitable for permanent retention, with regards to Paragraph 94 and Paragraph 145 of the NPPF, Policy 7.4 and 7.17 of the London Plan and Policies 2.18, 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Heritage Statement, prepared by Built Heritage Consultancy, dated July 2020; St Augustine's Be Green 02, As Designed, dated 13.07.2020; Energy Statement-Rev-4, prepared by Ingine, dated 23.07.2020; Dynamic Overheating Assessment-Issue-1, prepared by Ingine, dated 23.07.2020; 1712 PL(2-)232-Rev-P2; Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, samples of materials and finishes, to be used for the external school building surfaces/proposed facing materials, and façade detailing, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on external facing materials. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan and Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Construction works shall be carried out in accordance with Construction Management Plan, prepared by Bristow, dated 03.04.2020.
During all construction works, control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014;
- lighting in accordance with 'Guidance Note 01/20 For the Reduction of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals;
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays;
- notifications of works sent to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison;
- public display of contact details, including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: In the interest of safety and to protect residential amenity in accordance with Policies 5.3, 6.14, 7.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | A minimum of nine additional covered/sheltered cycle parking spaces shall be installed onsite prior to the first use of the school development hereby permitted and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided, to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with Policy 6.9 of The London Plan, Policy T5 of the Draft London Plan and Ealing's Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development'. | Prior to the first use of the school development, hereby permitted, at least ten additional active vehicle charging points and one additional passive electric vehicle charging point, shall be provided and available for use onsite. Total onsite provision of 16 active EVCPs and five passive EVCPs. The approved electric car charging facilities shall permanently be retained as such thereafter, except if passive charging points are being upgraded to active charging points.

Reason: To ensure appropriate provision of suitable infrastructure for electric or Ultra-Low Emission vehicles in accordance with Draft London Plan Policy T6.1. | Prior to the first use of the school development, hereby permitted, a revised Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include hours of use, times and frequency of activities, deliveries and collections, vehicle routes and movements, location of loading bays and quiet loading/unloading measures. The document shall also include measures to encourage cycling freight trips. The approved plan shall be adhered to permanently thereafter.

Reason: To minimise the impact on residential amenity and ensure pupil safety in accordance with Policies 6.14, 7.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | All tree and habitats (woodland) protection measures shall be installed prior to the commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance), in accordance with the approved Arboricultural Method Statement. Tree and habitats protection measures shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.

Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within five years from the completion of the development hereby permitted, shall be replaced by trees of an equivalent size and species.

Reason: To contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | (a) Prior to the commencement of development (excluding temporary block A but including ground works and site clearance), the following shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
A Tree Monitoring Plan to include:
- Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the 	development;
- Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key 	responsibilities and 	contact details;
- Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to 	arboricultural 	matters;
- A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all 	tree 	protection measures within the approved Tree Protection Plan, 	including:
- Prestart meeting with an Ealing Council Tree Officer;
- Initial implementation/installation of the tree protection measures;
- Approved incursions into construction exclusion zones;
- Final removal of the tree protection measures;
- Procedures for dealing with non-approved incursions into the 	construction exclusion 	zones as detailed in the approved arboricultural 	plans and reports.

(b) Within three months of first use of the school development hereby approved (excluding temporary block A and temporary block b), a report containing the following details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
- Results of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist with photos attached.
- Assessment of the retained and planted trees, including any necessary remedial action because of damage incurred during construction.

Reason: To contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | A suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and pits shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the school development hereby approved.  The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details:
- Full planting specification for the 15 proposed onsite trees - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes from the original application proposals.
- Locations of all proposed species.
- Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
- Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
- Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future
- Staking/tying method(s).
- Five-year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following first use of the approved development. The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive), with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

Reason: To contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Prior to any vegetation removal, trees T14 and T9 shall be assessed by a Suitably Qualified Licenced Bat Surveyor, for the potential to support roosting bats. The survey shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, prior to any vegetation removal. If evidence of roosting bats is found, protection and mitigation details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, prior to any vegetation removal, with approved measures adhered to.

Reason: To avoid potential impact to roosting or foraging bats, in accordance with Principle 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policy G6 of the Draft London Plan | (a) Urban Greening Factor measures, to achieve a minimum score of 0.625, shall be implemented in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following the first use of the sports hall.

(b) Within six months of implementation of Urban Greening Factor measures, details of onsite green infrastructure, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to verify the UGF score of 0.625 has been attained.
The approved UGF measure to achieve a score of 0.625 shall permanently be maintained in accordance with the Landscape and Habitat Management Plan (condition 16).

Reason: To ensure appropriate levels of high-quality landscaping and urban greening measures are provided in accordance with Policy G5 in the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 in the Development Management DPD. | (a) Prior to commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance), a toolbox talk shall be carried out with all site contractors, in relation to nesting birds and roosting bats.

(b) Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), the following details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
- Full details of planting species, numbers, size and location;
- Proposed sourcing of plant material;
- Details of replacement grassland, swales and detention basin;
- Details of bird and bat boxes.

Approved details shall be implemented within the first planting season, following first use of the approved sports hall and managed in accordance with the Landscape and Habitat Management Plan (see condition 16).

(c) Within six months of implementation of biodiversity enhancement measures, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, to verify onsite Biodiversity Net Gain has been attained.
(d) Felled trees shall be retained on site as dead-wood habitat.

Reason: To secure onsite biodiversity net gain and enhance onsite biodiversity in accordance with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | (a) A minimum of at least 398 sq. m. of biodiverse green roof, shall be laid out in accordance with the approved roof plan (1712 PL(2-) 403-Rev-P3). The detailed design of the roof shall incorporate the following:
- Be biodiversity based, with an extensive substrate base, varying in depth from 80mm to 150mm;
- Be planted/seeded with a mix of native wildflower species (not turf or sedum), within the first planting season following first use of the sports hall;
- Have efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation;

(b) Prior to the first use of the sports hall hereby approved, a five-year post planting green roof maintenance and inspection schedule, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

(c) The approved green roof shall be installed within the first planting season following first use of the sport hall, shall be retained as such thereafter and the approved maintenance plan shall be adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure the development contributes towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan, Draft London Plan Policy G5, Greater London Authority, Living Roofs and Walls, Technical Report: Supporting London Plan Policy and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy and Policies 5.10 and 5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to first use of the school (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), a Landscape and Habitat Management Plan, for a minimum period of five years, from the implementation of final planting, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure landscaping and urban greening measures are appropriately maintained in accordance with Policy G5 in the Draft London Plan and Policy 5.10 in the Development Management DPD. | Prior to first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B) and prior to the use of additional outdoor lighting, details of external lighting shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include geo-referenced lux contour plans and details of measures to prevent light spill onto retained ecological features and new habitat within and immediately adjacent to the development.

Reason: To avoid potential impact to roosting or foraging bats on or adjacent to the site in accordance with Principle 15 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policy G6 of the Draft London Plan. | (a)	Prior to the installation heat pump system and the PV panels, details of the specifications, design and layout of the proposed heat pump system and the PV panels and associated monitoring devices shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

(b) Prior to first use of development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 96.53% (equating to 41.41 tonnes of CO2 per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L (2013), shall be installed and operational. These CO2 savings shall be achieved through the Lean, Clean, Green Energy Hierarchy, as detailed in the revised Energy Statement prepared, by Ingine, dated July 2020, including:
i.	Lean, passive design measures to achieve an annual reduction of at least 12.21% equating to at least 1.46 tonnes in regulated CO2 emissions over BR Part L 2013.

ii.	Green, renewable energy equipment including the incorporation of a photovoltaic array with a capacity of approximately 53.28 kWp, and Air Source Heat Pump(s) to achieve an annual reduction of at least 84%, equating to 84.31 tonnes, in regulated CO2 emissions over Part L 2013.
iii.	Seen, heat and electric meters installed to monitor the performance of the PV and COP (efficiency) of the air source heat pump distribution loops.

(c)	Prior to first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), details of the installed heat pump system and PV shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the exact Heat Pump(s) thermal kilowatt output, heat output pipe diameter(s), monthly energy demand profile, collector parasitic load schematics, and the exact PV kWp capacity, the orientation, pitch and mounting of the panels, and the make and model of the panels, the name and contact details of the heat pump and PV installation contractor(s) and copies of the MCS certificates. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

(d)	All boilers to serve the energy requirements of the development detailed in the approved energy strategy shall be specified with NOx emissions (g/m²) that are compliant with or better than the ultra-low NOx (g/m²) benchmarks as detailed in Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

(e)	Within three months of first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), the relevant Display Energy Certificate (DEC), accompanying Advisory Reports and detailed BRUKL modelling output reports, including the TER and BER from the 'as built stage', shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with Policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of The London Plan, guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance and Policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | (a)	The development shall be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good, with a score of 68.28%.

(b)	Within three months of commencement of development (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

(c)	Within three months from the date of first use of the development (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

(d)	Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good, or higher standard, shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with Policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of The London Plan, guidance note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance and Policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | (a)	Prior to first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), suitable devices for monitoring any renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be automatically submitted to the Council, at daily intervals, for a period of four years, from first use and full operation of the energy equipment. The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission and format of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications, as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform (AEMP) information document. The developer shall contact the Council's chosen AEMP supplier (Energence Ltd) on commencement of construction.

(b) Prior to first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B), proof of a contractual arrangement with a certified contractor that provides for the ongoing, commissioning, maintenance, and repair of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment for a period of three years, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness and continued operation of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in accordance with Policy SI2 of the Draft London Plan. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes M and N of Part 7 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no extensions or alterations, nor any provision of new hardstanding, shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To safeguard the open space and manage future development proposals in accordance with Policies 7.18 and 2.18 and of The London Plan and Policy 2.18 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The number of pupils educated on the site at any one time shall not exceed 546 pupils without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To manage potential neighbouring residential amenity and transport impacts, in accordance with Policies 6.3, 6.11 and 7.15 of The London Plan and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The individual and combined external noise level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment, at the development site, shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level, by at least 10dBA, as measured at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises and in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To safeguard users of the development in accordance with Policy 7.15 of The London Plan, Policy 1.1 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration'. | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: To reduce the impact on air quality during the construction in accordance with Policy SI 1 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to the commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, and ground works and temporary Block A), details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation of a filtered fresh air ventilation system, capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air. Details shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system.  The approved ventilation system shall be installed prior to first and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate air quality with the development and to mitigate potential harm from the proximity with the North Circular Road, in accordance with 7.14 of the London Plan and Policy SI1 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to the commencement of the development (including demolition and site clearance), an Air Quality and Dust Management Plan (AQDMP), that includes an Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment, shall be produced in accordance with current guidance, 'The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG (July 2014), for the existing site and the proposed development. A scheme for air pollution mitigation measures, based on the findings of the report, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development (including demolition and site clearance). Approved mitigation measures shall be adhered to.

Reason: To ensure appropriate air pollution mitigation measures, in accordance with 7.14 of the London Plan and Policy SI1 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to installation of electricity substation, details of fence screening shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and installed prior to first use of the development hereby approved (excluding temporary Block A and temporary Block B).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan and Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding ground works, site clearance and installation of temporary structures) hereby approved, a detailed drainage design shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drainage design prior to the first use of permanent structures and maintained in perpetuity.
Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Principle 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework and Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of The London Plan.
